pages:
Language Processing Laboratory

Department of Linguistics, The University of Chicago

Thank you for your interest in our study!

As a reminder, this study runs best in Chrome or Firefox. If you are not using one of these browers, we recommend switching now to avoid future issues. When you are ready, please proceed by clicking the "next" button below.

consent.requirements: You must be at least 18 years old to participate in this study.
consent.purpose: In this research, we are investigating the processes involved in the comprehension of sentences.
consent.procedures: In this study, you will be presented with sets of shapes and determine whether statements about them are true or false.
consent.name: Dr. Ming Xiang

pages:
Thank you for considering participation in this study!

We're sorry it wasn't for you. You may close this window and return your HIT. There is no penalty for returning our lab's HITs.

Thank you for your interest in this study!

Unfortunately, you do not meet our requirements. You may close this window and return your HIT. There is no penalty for returning our lab's HITs.

Thank you for participating in our study!

In this experiment, first you will see three pictures for three seconds. During this time, please focus on the pictures. After three seconds, the experiment will automatically continue. Next you will see a single picture and a sentence about that picture. Your job is to decide whether these sentences are true or false. If the content of the sentence is compatible with what the images show, then it is "true"; otherwise it is "false".

Your responses in this experiment are timed. Please try to respond to each question as quickly and accurately as possible.

To begin, please click the button below.
